Summary PROFILE  
8+ yrs work experience with Global Internet giant 'Google, Inc.' I worked on their Online Advertising product 'Google AdWords' in various capacities. These included Client-facing Account Management through 1:1 and scalable initiatives, Industry Analysis and research, product support, customer service, and the like. 
 
Account Management experience (online sales, handling a multi-million dollar portfolio) for over a year, preceded by a year of Account Strategy and Analysis.  
Collaboration with multiple Google product teams on India marketing projects (Orkut, Maps, Docs, Apps).  
Certified Interviewer for over two years, working with the Staffing team. 
 
Specialties: account management, search engine optimization, advertising, content management, customer relations, industry analysis, market research, marketing, meeting facilitation, telephone skills, usability testing, Summary PROFILE

Specialties: account management, search engine optimization, advertising, content management, customer relations, industry analysis, market research, marketing, meeting facilitation, telephone skills, usability testing, Experience Account Manager - New Business Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Sydney Area, Australia - Work with the Acquisitions team for New Business 
- Successfully onboard new high potential brands into the AdWords and YouTube platform 
- Customize the AdWords suite of products to brands for increased ROI from digital ad campaigns, including Search, Display, YouTube, and Mobile 
- Provide onboarding, product, and implementation support 
- Introduce clients to betas, ad serving platforms, emerging market trends, and ROI-focused advertising strategies 
- Liaise with teams to offer branding-focused advertising opportunities 
- Conduct post-onboarding training for agencies and brands on the AdWords platform and campaign management across ad properties Industry Analyst Google April 2012  –  June 2012  (3 months) Greater Detroit Area - Prepare client-ready collateral for in-market teams. 
- Utilize Industry Benchmarking tools such as Hitwise, MRI, Compete, and others, to collate high-impact data to support recommendations.  
- Create visual illustrations for product adoption.  
- Create a repository of resources for future use. 
- Extract data points from Industry-specific news articles and incorporate them into the client story. Resource Group Founder & Lead (India) Google October 2010  –  January 2011  (4 months) Hyderabad, - Organize Diversity-focused events to create an inclusive office space for everyone.  
- Formulate and conduct manager and peer level training to sensitize everyone on issues related to sexuality and sexual preferences.  
- Represent Google India externally at inter-company events and forums.  
- Handle social presence of the group internally through frequent engagement programs. 
- Coordination with global heads around annual budget and plans. 
- Spearhead the first ever Google India contingent to participate at an LGBT Pride Parade in India - a first for any corporate. 
My efforts resulted in  
- Keynote Speaker on 'International LGBT Rights' at the 'Legalise Love' conference held in London. 
- Speaker at CommunityBusiness.org's event in Bangalore, India (Launch event for the org's employee handbook on LGBT issues) 
- Keynote Speaker at Google Ann Arbor's Annual Pride Event (June 2012) 
- Google India featured in the cover story of the Forbes India magazine in August 2011.  
- Google India featured as a Best Practice LGBT Employer in the Global LGBT research report by Catalyst.org Account Manager (Retail) Google April 2009  –  December 2009  (9 months) Hyderabad Area, India - Manage a $8 million quarterly portfolio of Online advertising Retail accounts through deep understanding of client goals and objectives 
- Mapping comprehensive campaigns for clients to achieve their business objectives through mediums such as Search, Display, Mobile, YouTube, and Remarketing 
- Provide bid landscapes, investment and return estimates, and work with clients on a regular basis to ensure satisfactory performance of clients’ online advertising efforts 
- Research latest and upcoming industry trends and apply them to clients’ business objectives to help them achieve the most out of their advertising budgets 
- Interactions with clients for account/campaign performance, new product features, and optimization opportunities Account Strategist and Analyst Google February 2008  –  March 2009  (1 year 2 months) - Preparation of strategic reports for some of the highest revenue Retail clients.  
- Preparation of Client decks for client visits and client meetings.  
- Revenue reporting through creation of some key templates and spreadsheets.  
- Innovation through launch of new reports along with higher levels of analysis. - Helping to shape and cement the way we work with agencies from an acquisition perspective going forward (drawing on experience from my agency background)

- Ensuring the smooth transition of clients from the acquisition team to the account management team 
- Working towards aggressive revenue targets which I managed to exceed by over 300%. I achieved in quarter revenue of over 100K which is far above that expected of a brand new sales representative. Summary Work is more than calculating profits, balancing supply & demand or pushing paper. Work is people coming together to dream, create, hack, hustle and make. People should connect easily to share ideas, develop them together, and get things done from anywhere. Technology should make work easier and faster, not harder. It should get out of the way so our ideas have space to grow and inspiration is free to strike at any moment. When we use the tools that make our lives easier, we can do our best work.
